result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Engelmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI - 8th offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by your agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $3600.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Driving privileges revoked 36 months.  Ignition Interlock Ordered.  Pay prosecution costs of $140.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP forthwith; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 241 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $3600 plus costs including prosecution costs in the amount of $140.  All costs & DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
